title: WAGE GARNISHMENT After 20 years!!! NEVER SERVED AND Default Judgment never appeared on credit report
question: • 1994 vehicle airbag malfunctioned causing an accident. It was agreed I wouldn't sue Ford.
answers: It appears you have continued to violate the first rule of law: do not represent yourself. At this stage, given the facts you have posted, it appears any action you could take, short of filing a voluntary bankruptcy petition and/or another claim of exemption, would not be helpful. BTW, you did not state the status of your present claim of exemption. You may be limited to a BK petition. I recommend you immediately consult BK counsel. Good luck. – Michael

A 20-year old debt will be exceedingly difficult to get it set aside for lack of service, especially since you have been aware of the judgment since 2011. Thus, your options are to propose a settlement that you can afford to ensure that a satisfaction of judgment in full is filed OR discharge this in bankruptcy. You need to consult with an experienced debt collection DEFENSE attorney or a bankruptcy attorney, or both.

It is unfortunate that you did not consult with a personal injury attorney 20 years ago for the airbags problem, so as to obtain a release of the claims against you, while you still had claims you could have pursued from the accident. When you failed to pursue your claims within the statute of limitations period, you essentially let the other side wait and sue you, but you were not properly served with the lawsuit, so you never became aware of it until 2011.

A Claim of Exemption is not a motion to set aside a void (or voidable) judgment. If you were not served, and had no notice of the lawsuit, you could file a motion to set aside the default judgment. However, such a motion must be filed promptly after you learn that a judgment has been entered. Here, you have waited two years, so it would be very difficult to win a motion to vacate.

In 2013, the evidence relating to your Claim of Exemption is evidence of your present financial situation. It is not the place to bring in old pictures of the accident or other evidence that would show that you had a valid defense to the original lawsuit.
